meanings.definition: Cause (something) to become outdated or no longer in use.
meanings.sent1: Using old technology often obsoletes devices quickly.
meanings.sent2: The new software update obsoletes the need for manual data entry.
meanings.sent3: The invention of self-driving cars obsoletes the need for traditional driving lessons.
meanings.sent4: The rise of digital photography obsoletes film cameras.
meanings.sent5: Constant innovation in the tech industry obsoletes products faster than ever before.

meanings.definition: No longer produced or used; out of date.
meanings.sent1: The obsolete computer system was unable to run modern software.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to replace their obsolete machinery with newer models.
meanings.sent3: His collection of obsolete gadgets was a quirky reminder of past trends.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned factory stood as a monument to obsolete manufacturing practices.
meanings.sent5: The obsolete fashion trend made a brief comeback on the runway.
